title: Question 22
prompt:
According to Newton’s law of inertia, an object at rest will stay at rest until a force acts upon it. Also, an object set in motion will continue to move in a straight path at a constant speed unless forces act upon it. For example, when a pitcher pitches a baseball, the ball would eventually slow down and be pulled towards the ground.

Which of the following forces are acting on the ball as it travels through the air?
feedback: Every object is influenced by gravitational force. Also, air itself can act as a force moving against an object; parachutes are an example of this. So, a baseball travelling through the air is most influenced by gravity and air friction.
